<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>

	<h:head>

			<instance>

					<solutions>
						<charge_battery />

						<dnd />

						<silent_profile />
						<phone_volume />
						<app_permissions />

						<input_language />
						<wrong_phone />
						<broken_phone />
						<lost_stolen_phone />
						<corrupt_app />
						<reinstall_app />
						<restore_user />
						<out_of_credit />
						<gprs_incorrect />
						<sim_not_working />
						<missing_data />
						<missing_multimedia />
						<content_problem />
						<error_in_application />
						<reassign_cases />
					</solutions>
					<follow_up>
						<issue_resolved />
						<issue_description />
						<other_issue />
						<another_issue />
						<has_another_problem />
						<thanks_fixed />
						<thanks_reported />
					</follow_up>
					<verify_dnd_registration />
					<verify_battery_charging />
					<verify_multimedia_settings />
					<verify_connection_errors />
					<verify_date_time />
					<verify_phone_lock_settings />
					<verify_permissions />
					<verify_shortcut />
					<verify_phone_language />
					<verify_app_language />
					<verify_login_info />
					<verify_typing_language />
					<verify_form_constraints />
					<verify_form_not_there />
					<verify_silent_profile />
					<verify_manually_sync />
					<verify_application_errors />
					<verify_case_filter />
					<escalate_missing_cases />
					<escalate_broken_phone />
					<escalate_corrupt_application />
					<escalate_restore_user />
					<escalate_missing_multimedia />
					<escalate_app_missing />
					<escalate_no_credit />
					<escalate_sim_card />
					<escalate_gprs_settings />
					<escalate_content_problem />
					<escalate_wrong_phone />
					<escalate_application_error />
					<escalate_phone_lost_stolen />
					<escalate_reassign_cases />
					<requires_escalation />
					<debug_level />
					<issue_identified />
					<application_version />
					<application_date />
					<other_issues_description />
					<description />
					<show_solutions_folder />
					<phone_number />
					<other_issues />
					<show_escalations />
					<show_app_version_date />
					<date_identified />
					<top_of_tech_support_list />

				</data>
			</instance>
			<bind nodeset="/data/info" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/info/have_other_number" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/info/alt_phone_number" type="xsd:string" constraint="string-length(.) > 9 and string-length(.) < 11" jr:constraintMsg="jr:itext('alt_phone_number-constraintMsg')" relevant="/data/info/have_other_number = 'no'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/info/help_identifying_issue" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/info/identified_issue" relevant="/data/info/help_identifying_issue = 'no'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/info/other_issue_details" type="xsd:string" relevant="selected(/data/info/identified_issue, 'other_issue')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/info/application_version_manual" type="xsd:string" relevant="/data/info/help_identifying_issue = 'no' and /data/show_app_version_date = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/info/application_date_manual" type="xsd:date" constraint=". > today() - 730 and .<= today()" jr:constraintMsg="jr:itext('application_date_manual-constraintMsg')" relevant="/data/info/help_identifying_issue = 'no' and /data/show_app_version_date = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification" relevant="/data/info/help_identifying_issue = 'yes' or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, 'login_error')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/username_match" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/is_phone_broken" relevant="/data/issue_identification/username_match = 'yes'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/phone_broken" relevant="/data/issue_identification/is_phone_broken = 'yes'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/phone_broken_other" type="xsd:string" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/phone_broken, 'other')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/see_login_screen" relevant="/data/issue_identification/is_phone_broken = 'no'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/why_no_startup" relevant="/data/issue_identification/see_login_screen = 'no'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/other_start_app_issue" type="xsd:string" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/why_no_startup, 'other')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up" relevant="/data/issue_identification/see_login_screen = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/application_version_guided" type="xsd:string" required="false()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/application_date_guided" type="xsd:date" constraint=". > today() - 730" jr:constraintMsg="jr:itext('application_date_guided-constraintMsg')" required="false()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/can_login" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/login_issue" relevant="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/can_login = 'no'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/other_login_issue" type="xsd:string" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/login_issue, 'other')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/guidance_message" relevant="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/can_login = 'yes'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/post_login_issue" relevant="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/can_login = 'yes'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/other_issue_after_login" type="xsd:string" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/post_login_issue, 'other')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/cant_open_form_reason" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/post_login_issue, 'cant_open_form')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/other_cant_open_form_issue" type="xsd:string" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/cant_open_form_reason, 'other')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/issue_within_form" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/post_login_issue, 'issue_in_form')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/content_problem_description" type="xsd:string" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/issue_within_form, 'content_problem')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/other_issue_inside_form" type="xsd:string" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/issue_within_form, 'other')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/multimedia_settings" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/post_login_issue, 'no_multimedia') or selected(/data/issue_identification/phone_broken, 'no_phone_multimedia') or selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/issue_within_form, 'missing_multimedia')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/multimedia_settings/file_on_phone" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/issue_within_form, 'missing_audio') or selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/post_login_issue, 'no_audio')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/multimedia_settings/silent_profile_on" relevant="/data/issue_identification/multimedia_settings/file_on_phone = 'no'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/app_error" relevant="/data/verify_application_errors = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/app_error/app_error_message" type="xsd:string" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/app_error/app_error_fix_date_time" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/app_error/app_error_reproducible" relevant="/data/issue_identification/app_error/app_error_fix_date_time = 'no'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/app_error/app_error_steps" type="xsd:string" relevant="/data/issue_identification/app_error/app_error_reproducible = 'yes'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/check_missing_data" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/cant_open_form_reason, 'no_case')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/check_missing_data/case_filter_set" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/check_missing_data/manual_sync_possible" relevant="/data/issue_identification/check_missing_data/case_filter_set = 'no'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/check_missing_data/entering_in_demo_mode" relevant="/data/issue_identification/check_missing_data/manual_sync_possible = 'yes'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/connection_settings" relevant="/data/verify_connection_errors = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/connection_settings/connection_errors_date_time" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/connection_settings/have_credit" relevant="/data/issue_identification/connection_settings/connection_errors_date_time = 'no'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/connection_settings/gprs_correct" relevant="/data/issue_identification/connection_settings/have_credit = 'yes'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/connection_settings/access_internet" relevant="/data/issue_identification/connection_settings/gprs_correct = 'yes'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/login_issues" relevant="/data/verify_login_info = 'yes'" required="false()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/login_issues/login_error" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/login_issues/can_user_login_now" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/app_installed" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/why_no_startup, 'cant_find_app')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/issue_identification/app_installed/app_in_games" relevant="selected(/data/issue_identification/why_no_startup, 'cant_find_app')" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions" relevant="/data/show_solutions_folder = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/charge_battery" relevant="/data/verify_battery_charging = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/date_time" relevant="/data/verify_date_time = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/lock_settings" relevant="/data/verify_phone_lock_settings = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/dnd" relevant="/data/verify_dnd_registration = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/phone_language" relevant="/data/verify_phone_language = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/silent_profile" relevant="/data/verify_silent_profile = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/phone_volume" relevant="/data/verify_multimedia_settings = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/app_permissions" relevant="/data/verify_permissions = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/app_shortcut" relevant="/data/verify_shortcut = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/app_language" relevant="/data/verify_app_language = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/manually_sync" relevant="/data/verify_manually_sync = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/case_filter" relevant="/data/verify_case_filter = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/app_navigation" relevant="/data/verify_form_not_there = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/form_constraints" relevant="/data/verify_form_constraints = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/input_language" relevant="/data/verify_typing_language = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/wrong_phone" relevant="/data/escalate_wrong_phone = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/broken_phone" relevant="/data/escalate_broken_phone = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/lost_stolen_phone" relevant="/data/escalate_phone_lost_stolen = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/corrupt_app" relevant="/data/escalate_corrupt_application = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/reinstall_app" relevant="/data/escalate_app_missing = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/restore_user" relevant="/data/escalate_restore_user = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/out_of_credit" relevant="/data/escalate_no_credit = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/gprs_incorrect" relevant="/data/escalate_gprs_settings = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/sim_not_working" relevant="/data/escalate_sim_card = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/missing_data" relevant="/data/escalate_missing_cases = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/missing_multimedia" relevant="/data/escalate_missing_multimedia = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/content_problem" relevant="/data/escalate_content_problem = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/error_in_application" relevant="/data/escalate_application_error = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/solutions/reassign_cases" relevant="/data/escalate_reassign_cases = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/follow_up" relevant="/data/issue_identification/login_issues/can_user_login_now = 'yes' or /data/other_issues = 'yes' or /data/show_solutions_folder = 'yes' or /data/issue_identification/app_error/app_error_fix_date_time = 'yes' or /data/issue_identification/connection_settings = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/follow_up/issue_resolved" relevant="/data/show_escalations = 'no'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/follow_up/issue_description" type="xsd:string" relevant="/data/follow_up/issue_resolved = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/follow_up/other_issue" type="xsd:string" relevant="/data/follow_up/issue_resolved = 'no' or /data/show_escalations = 'yes'" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/follow_up/another_issue" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/follow_up/has_another_problem" relevant="/data/follow_up/another_issue = 'yes' and /data/follow_up/another_issue != ''" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/follow_up/thanks_fixed" relevant="/data/follow_up/issue_resolved = 'yes' and /data/follow_up/another_issue != ''" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/follow_up/thanks_reported" relevant="(/data/show_escalations = 'yes' or /data/follow_up/issue_resolved = 'no') and /data/follow_up/another_issue != ''" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_dnd_registration" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/phone_broken, 'spam_messages') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "dnd"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_battery_charging" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/phone_broken, 'phone_wont_turn_on') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "charge_battery"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_multimedia_settings" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/multimedia_settings/silent_profile_on = 'no' or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "phone_volume"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_connection_errors" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/login_issue, 'connection_failed') or selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/post_login_issue, 'syncing_failure') or /data/issue_identification/check_missing_data/manual_sync_possible = 'no', 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_date_time" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/phone_broken, 'date_wrong') or selected(/data/issue_identification/why_no_startup, 'date_time_certificate') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "date_time"), 'yes', 'no') " />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_phone_lock_settings" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/phone_broken, 'phone_locked') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "lock_settings"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_permissions" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/why_no_startup = 'permissions_issue' or /data/issue_identification/can_start_up/login_issue = 'permissions_prompt' or /data/issue_identification/can_start_up/issue_within_form = 'permissions_prompt' or /data/info/identified_issue = 'app_permissions', 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_shortcut" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/app_installed/app_in_games = 'yes' or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "app_shortcut"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_phone_language" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/phone_broken, "wrong_phone_language") or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "phone_language"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_app_language" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/post_login_issue, 'app_language_wrong') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, 'app_language'), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_login_info" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/login_issue, 'login_incorrect_message') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, 'login_error'), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_typing_language" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/issue_within_form, 'type_language_wrong') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, 'input_language'), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_form_constraints" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/issue_within_form, 'cant_move_forward') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, 'form_constraints'), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_form_not_there" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/cant_open_form_reason, 'no_form') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, 'app_navigation'), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_silent_profile" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/multimedia_settings/silent_profile_on = 'yes' or /data/info/identified_issue = "silent_profile", 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_manually_sync" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/connection_settings/access_internet = 'yes' or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, 'manually_sync'), 'yes','no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_application_errors" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/why_no_startup, 'application_error') or selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/login_issue, 'application_error') or selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/post_login_issue, 'application_errors') or selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/cant_open_form_reason, 'application_errors') or selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/issue_within_form, 'application_error'), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/verify_case_filter" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/check_missing_data/case_filter_set = 'yes' or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "case_filter"),'yes','no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/escalate_missing_cases" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/check_missing_data/entering_in_demo_mode = 'no' or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "missing_data"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/escalate_broken_phone" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/phone_broken, "phone_broken") or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "broken_phone"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/escalate_corrupt_application" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/why_no_startup, "corrupt_application") or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "corrupt_app"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/escalate_restore_user" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/login_issues/can_user_login_now = 'no' or selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/login_issue, 'restore_user_prompt') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, 'restore_user'), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/escalate_missing_multimedia" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/multimedia_settings/file_on_phone = 'no' or selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/issue_within_form, 'missing_multimedia') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, 'missing_multimedia'), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/escalate_app_missing" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/app_installed/app_in_games = 'no' or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "reinstall_app"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/escalate_no_credit" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/connection_settings/have_credit = 'no' or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "out_of_credit"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/escalate_sim_card" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/connection_settings/access_internet = 'no' or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "sim_not_working"), 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/escalate_gprs_settings" calculate="if(/data/issue_identification/connection_settings/gprs_correct = 'no' or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, "gprs_incorrect"),'yes','no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/escalate_content_problem" calculate="if(selected(/data/issue_identification/can_start_up/issue_within_form, 'content_problem') or selected(/data/info/identified_issue, 'content_problem'), 'yes', 'no')" />

					<text id="retry_login-label">
						<value>GUIDE USER TO ENTER THEIR USERNAME AND PASSWORD AND TRY LOGIN AGAIN. 
If the user is seeing a prompt that says “Login Incorrect” this means either the username is incorrect or the password is incorrect.     1.	Verify that the username displayed on the login screen is correct referencing the MASTER USER LIST.    2.	If username is incorrect, ESCALATE the issue to the ICT Coordinator.    3.	If username is correct, ask the caller if they know the password (123).    4.	Delete the incorrect password. Push any button and a blank writing page will appear.    5.	The writing cursor will be at the left side of the password. To delete the incorrect password, guide the user to move the cursor to the right until they reach the last star. Delete the stars by pushing the button above the red POWER button or the cancel button.    6.	Guide the user to type the password 1-2-3 in the blank writing window(this can be challenging for some users because the numbers are visible for a short time and then turn into stars). Push the middle button once.    7.	Go to the LOGIN button and push the middle button once. The Login button will change from grey to blue.    8.  If you have successfully logged in to the user’s account, the username will be visible at the top of the screen.  REMINDERS:       -   	The user should not share their password with anyone.       -   	Remind the user to complete all of her actual work in login mode. The demo mode is used for practice and during training, but all real work should be completed in login mode. </value>
					</text>

					</text>
					<text id="charge_battery-label">
						<value>GUIDE THE USER TO TURN ON PHONE AND CHARGE THE BATTERY. 
If the phone is off, push and hold the red POWER button to turn it on.    1. Check that the battery is properly inserted in the phone.    2. If the phone does not turn on, it may have run out of battery.    3. Connect the charger to a wall outlet and then connect the charger to the phone.  *A charging indicator should appear on the screen, but this may take a few minutes if the battery is completely discharged. It may take a few minutes before CommCare can load.*    4. If the phone does not charge, it is a broken phone and should be escalated.    5. Once charging, guide the user to find the battery icon on the header of the home screen. Explain to them that when this icon is completely white, the battery is full.</value>
					</text>
					<text id="date_time-label">
						<value>GUIDE THE USER TO CHECK AND FIX THE DATE AND TIME OF PHONE. 
   1.  From the main screen, push the center button to enter the MENU page.    2.  Go to the SETTINGS icon and push the center button.    3.  Go down four times to the DATE AND TIME icon and push the center button to select.    4.  Push the center button again on DATE AND TIME SETTINGS (listed first). You can edit the date and time here.    5.  The DATE section should be selected green.  Go down to the TIME ZONE section and check that it is set to GMT +5.5 (move to the right or left until it is selected).    6.  Select the DATE section and check that the correct date is entered. Enter the date as [DD-MM-YYYY] using the number buttons (will enter 8 digits total).    7.  Select the TIME section and check that the correct time is entered. Enter in the time using the number buttons.    8.  Exit the DATE AND TIME section by pushing the center button.    9.  Return to the main MENU by pushing the red POWER button. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="lock_settings-label">
						<value>GUIDE THE USER TO UNLOCK PHONE AND CHANGE LOCK SETTINGS. 
   1.  If the phone is locked, a message will appear saying ‘PUSH UNLOCK, FOLLOWED BY THE STAR BUTTON.’ Unlock refers to the center button, so push the center button and then quickly push the star button.    2.  To lock the phone once in use, push UNLOCK again, then the star button.    3.  If you never want to see the lock screen again:        a.  From the main screen, push the middle button to enter the MENU page.       b.  Go to the SETTINGS icon and push the center button.       c.  Go down nine times to the PHONE icon and push the center button to select it.       d.  Go down twice to AUTOMATIC buttonGUARD. To turn it off, push the center button, go down to OFF and push the center button again to select it.       e.  Return to the main MENU by pushing the red POWER button. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="dnd-label">
						<value>GUIDE THE USER TO REGISTER FOR DND 
*The call center will be able to stop any unwanted SMS messages to their phone, but not calls.* If you keep getting unwanted text messages from the service provider, you can activate the DO NOT DISTURB (DND) service.        -   	To activate the DND service, write the text message ‘START 0’ (no quotations, zero) to 1909. If you register for DND, then this will also block any SMSs sent from CommCareHQ to the user’s phone. If DND is activated, then another SMS also needs to be sent from the phone to allow the users to receive messages sent from CommCareHQ.    1.  To opt-in for messages from CommCareHQ, SMS ‘START 0’ to 07760962755.     2.  The success message should read as follows:       You have successfully opted to receive all messages from Dimagi Inc. To opt out of these messages in the future, please send STOP to +917760962755</value>
					</text>
					<text id="phone_language-label">
						<value>GUIDE THE USER TO CHANGE PHONE LANGUAGE 
From English > HINDI:    1.	From the main screen, push the center button to enter the MENU page.    2.	Go to the SETTINGS icon and push the center button.    3.	Go down nine times to the PHONE icon and push the center button to select it.    4.	The LANGUAGE SETTINGS section should be selected. Push the center button.    5.	Move to the right until Hindi is selected and then push the center button to select it. This will change the language from English to Hindi.    6.	Return to the main menu by pushing the red POWER button. From Hindi > ENGLISH:    1.	From the main screen, push the center button to enter the MENU page.    2.	Go to the SETTINGS icon and push the center button.    3.	Go down nine times to the PHONE icon and push the center button.    4.	The LANGUAGE SETTINGS section should be selected. Push the center button.    5.	Move to the right until Hindi is selected and then push the center button to select it. This will change the language from English to Hindi.    6.	Return to the main menu by pushing the red POWER button. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="silent_profile-label">
						<value>GUIDE THE USER TO TURN OFF SILENT PROFILE 
*It is very important for your phone to be in GENERAL PROFILE and not Silent Profile.   If your phone is in silent mode you will not be able to hear the audio prompts in the COMMCARE APPLICATION. * To turn off the SILENT profile:      1.  Return to the main menu by pushing the red POWER button.    2.  From the main screen, push the # button down for a few seconds. You will get a message “Activated Profile: General” and then the phone will have sound.    3.  If the message “Activated Profile: Silent” appears, the phone will not have sound.  Make sure you are in ‘PROFILE: GENERAL’ by holding down the # button.    4.  Ask the user to open a form in the application and test the audio.    5.  If it does not play, please check if the Application Tone is off.     6.  Exit the application. Press the red POWER button to return to the home screen.     7.  Push the center button.    8.  Go to SETTINGS.     9.  Go to TONES.    10.  Go to APPLICATION TONES.    11.  This should be set to ON.     12.  If it is set to OFF, then push the right directional button once to change from OFF to ON.    13.  Return to the main MENU by pushing the red POWER button. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="phone_volume-label">
						<value>GUIDE THE USER TO TURN UP THE PHONE VOLUME 
*If the phone is not in silent or vibrate mode, but the audio messages are still not playing in the application, the volume on the phone may be really low.* To turn up the phone volume:    1.  Return to the main menu by pushing the red POWER button.     2.  From the main screen, push the center button to enter the MENU page.    3.  Go to the MEDIA icon and push the center button.    4.  In the MEDIA MENU, go down two times to the MEDIA PLAYER icon and push the center button to select it.    5.  Go to MEDIA PLAYER should be selected; push the center button to open it.    6.  Volumes lines will appear in green at the right bottom corner of the screen. Push the up button to increase the green bars until the volume is at maximum (five bars).    7.  Return to the main MENU by pushing the red POWER button..    8.  Ask the user to open a form in the application and test the audio. The audio should play.     9.  If it does not play, please check if the Application Tone is set off.     10.  Exit the application. Press the red POWER button to return to the home screen.     11.  Push the center button.     12.  Go to SETTINGS.     13.  Go to TONES.    14.  Go to APPLICATION TONES.    15.  This should be set to ON. If it is set to OFF, then push the right directional button once to change it from OFF to ON.    16.  Return to the main MENU by pushing the red POWER button. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="app_permissions-label">
						<value>GUIDE THE USER TO CHECK AND FIX APPLICATION PERMISSIONS 
Various actions require user permission before they can be performed. You should configure the phone to always allow these actions to make the application run smoothly. Follow the below steps if the user says the phone displays long messages for permissions.     1.	From the home screen of the phone, go to the MENU screen.    2.	Go to APPLICATIONS. Push the center button to open it.     3.	Go to the GAMES folder and push the center button to open it.    4.	 Go to COMMCARE APPLICATION. Do not open the application.    5.	Push the button above the green call button to open the OPTIONS menu.     6.	Go to APPLICATION ACCESS and push the center button to select it.    7.	Push the center button on NETWORK ACCESS.     8.	Push the center button on ALWAYS ALLOWED.    9.	Repeat the previous steps for the following settings to ALWAYS ALLOW them:        DATA ACCESS -> READ USER DATA        DATA ACCESS -> ADD AND EDIT DATA    10.	You have successfully configured the application settings.     11.	Push the button above the red POWER button to exit.     12.	Advise the user to open a form in the application to see if the problem has been resolved.  REMINDERS TO THE CALLER:     -  Please do not change the application permissions at any point    -  Avoid removing the Memory Card.  </value>
					</text>
					<text id="app_shortcut-label">
						<value>GUIDE THE USER TO RESET THE HOME SCREEN SHORTCUT 
The following are steps to set COMMCARE APPLICATION shortcut in the home screen:    1.	On the home screen, push the center button to open MENU.    2.	Go to SETTINGS and push the center button.    3.	Push down button 5 times to MY SHORTCUTS and then push the center button.    4.	Push down button once to RIGHT SELECTION button and then push the center button.     5.	Keep pushing the down button until you find APPLICATIONS LIST and then push the center button.     6.	Keep pushing the down button to find the COMMCARE APPLICATION and then push the center button.    7.	Push the red POWER button that will bring you to the home screen.    8.	On completing the above steps, the shortcut for the application will have been set to the button above the red POWER button. You can verify with user if pushing that button opens the COMMCARE APPLICATION.  REMINDERS:       -   	Explain that this file should never be deleted and often gets deleted when the user goes to put songs on the memory card. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="app_language-label">
						<value>GUIDE THE USER TO CHANGE LANGUAGE IN THE APPLICATION. 
You can change the language of the application once it is open. To change from English > HINDI:    1.	Ask the user to open the application and open a form so that they see a question.    2.	Push the button above the green button.    3.	Go down to the MENU ‘LANGUAGE’.    4.	Move to the right to open a menu, then move down and push the center button to select HIN. The application should now be in Hindi.  To change from Hindi > ENGLISH:    1.	Push the button above the green button.    2.	Go down twice to the MENU ‘LANGUAGE’.    3.	Move to the right to open a menu, then move down and push the center button to select ENG. The application should now be in English. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="manually_sync-label">
						<value>GUIDE USER TO MANUALLY SYNC THE PHONE. 
When a user opens the application, it will auto-sync by default. When auto sync fails, the application will generate an error on the phone that says FAILED TO UPDATE. Auto-sync failure reasons:     1.	LIMITED NETWORK CONNECTIVITY (can continue to work on application and sync manually at a later time).     2.	GPRS SETTINGS ARE INACCURATE (see FAQ#301 - How to verify GPRS settings)     3.	INSUFFICIENT BALANCE ON THE PHONE (go to FAQ#300 - How to check if the user has sufficient balance).  To sync data manually:    1.	Open the COMMCARE APPLICATION.    2.	On the module screen, push the (number) 6 button that will initiate data sync (don’t push any other button while syncing!)    3.	If the manual sync was successful, a message will appear that says “DATA SYNC WAS SUCCESSFUL”.    4.	If the data was not successful or failed, you will see a message that says “FAILED TO UPDATE.”     5.	Ask the user to move to an open location or away from the current location and retry STEP 2.  REMINDERS:       -   	The ‘SYNC’ option on the main screen be  red when your phone has not been able to sync for a few days; you should manually sync immediately.       -   	Ensure while syncing data on your phone that you have good network connectivity, accurate GPRS settings, and a minimum balance.</value>
					</text>
					<text id="case_filter-label">
						<value>HOW TO VERIFY AND REMOVE A CASE FILTER 
If case filtering is ON, the user will not see their full case list, which may be why they cannot see the desired care. To remove the case filter:     1.	Ask the user to open the case list.    2.	Verify if case list shows the message “NO MATCHES” and if so, check if anything is written under “FIND.”    3.	If so, push the button above the red POWER button to erase the typed in text.    4.	Push the top down button to see if cases are now showing up. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="app_navigation-label">
						<value>GUIDE USER IN APPLICATION NAVIGATION 
Review the caller’s understanding of these questions:       -   	What do the red and green buttons do?       -   	What do the directional buttons do?       -   	What does the middle button do?       -   	What do the right and left soft buttons do?       -   	Which button takes you forward? Which is the “OK” button? What does “OK” mean?        -   	Which button takes you back to the previous Menu?        -   	Where is the hash button? What does the hash button do? When does a mobile user have to use the hash button?	  Refer to the chart in the Troubleshooting Manual to see more information on how to guide the user in application navigation. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="form_constraints-label">
						<value>DISCUSS FORM CONSTRAINTS WITH USER 
Please see APPENDIX 3: FAQ 405 – FORM CONSTRAINTS. Review the constraints for the form that the caller is having trouble with. Users may have questions about why a question is not displaying in a form (skip logic) or why a message is appearing and not letting them move forward (validation constraints or required questions).    1.	Ask the user which module, form and question(s) they are confused about.    2.	Find the question in the excel sheet (APPENDIX 3: FORM CONSTRAINTS) and explain the possible reasons the question is not displaying  or is blocking the user from going forward.  </value>
					</text>
					<text id="input_language-label">
						<value>GUIDE USER TO CHANGE INPUT LANGUAGE 
The input language needs to be in Hindi to keep all data consistent. To change the input language from English > HINDI:     1.	Push the red POWER button to return to the home screen.    2.	Push the middle button once to open the MENU screen.    3.	Go to the MESSAGING icon and push the middle button.    4.	Go to the CREATE MESSAGE icon and push the middle button.    5.	Go to the MESSAGE icon and push the middle button.    6.	You are now at the SMS composition window with the cursor in the space to write the phone number.    7.	Push the down button once to move the cursor to bigger part of the screen where you can write a message.    8.	Push the button above the green button to open the OPTIONS menu.     9.	Go to WRITING LANGUAGE and push the middle button.    10.	Go to HINDI and push the middle button to select and configure the default writing language to be HINDI.    11.	Push the red POWER button to return to the home screen.  REMINDERS:       -   	Several letters can be found under each number. All the vowels can be found in 2 and 3 and some in 1. You have to type the number a specific number of times to get the letter you want. Push star button after the first letter, then enter second letter. They will be joined.       -   	Push the buttons at the right speed.       -   	0 button adds a space.       -   	Pushing the HASH (#) button changes the typing mode (numeric, English, Hindi).       -   	Holding down the HASH (#) button changes prediction.       -   	You can find special symbols by pushing and holding down the star button. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="wrong_phone-label">
						<value>WRONG PHONE 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: Please enter as much information about the issue as possible, especially:       -   	What is the mobile phone code that is recorded on the caller’s phone?       -   	What is the mobile phone code that is noted in the Master User List?       -   	What other discrepancies are there as reported by the caller and the Master User List? ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS: Please take the necessary steps to find and return the correct phone to the user. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="broken_phone-label">
						<value>BROKEN PHONE 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: Please enter as much information about the hardware or phone-related issue, especially:       -   	When did it stop working?        -   	Are there any physical problems with the phone? (e.g., screen broken/blurry, phone damaged around the edges, camera has a scratch, buttonpad button has fallen off, battery exploded, phone’s cover melted etc.)       -   	How did the damage occur? (e.g., phone fell from a high distance, children playing with the phone, phone battery was stored too close to the stove, phone fell into water, etc.).       -   	Record any phone-related issues software issues that are unrelated to the COMMCARE APPLICATION. ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS: If the phone is broken, please take the necessary steps to have it fixed or replaced. Follow internal policies regarding phone replacement and/or repair. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="lost_stolen_phone-label">
						<value>LOST/STOLEN PHONE 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: Instruct the FLW or the caller to register the lost and/or stolen phone as the nearest police station and to file an FIR. This issue will be escalated to the ICT Coordinator.  Please enter as much information about the lost or stolen device as reported by the caller, especially:       -   	What is lost? The phone, the memory card, the charger, the battery, the phone cover, etc.       -   	How did the FLW lose the device?       -   	Since how long has the device been missing?       -   	Has the FLW/caller filed an FIR? ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS: If the phone is lost or stolen, please take the necessary steps to have it fixed or replaced. Follow internal policies regarding phone replacement and/or repair. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="corrupt_app-label">
						<value>CORRUPT APPLICATION 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: Please enter as much information about the hardware or phone-related issue experienced by the caller, especially:       -   	How does the user normally close the application?        -   	Remind the user of the appropriate way to close the application to avoid application corruption.        -   	They should not push the red POWER button to exit and close the form, but instead should navigate backwards through the menus until they reach the logic screen and then exit the application. Use the right OPTIONS button to exit all the way.        -   	Pushing the red POWER button frequently could break the application. ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS: The application needs to be re-installed. Please see the Troubleshooting Manual (FAQ#904) for more details on how to re-install the application.  </value>
					</text>
					<text id="reinstall_app-label">
						<value>REINSTALL APPLICATION 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: Please enter as much information as possible about location of the file, especially:       -   	Is the application in the Memory Card?       -   	Is the complete multimedia file still located in the Memory Card? Verify the size of the latest multimedia folder and try to guide the user to tell you the size of that folder in their Memory Card. ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS: Please see the Troubleshooting Manual (FAQ#904 and 905.) for more details on how to re-install the application. REMINDERS:       -   	Explain that this file should never be deleted and often gets deleted when the user goes to put songs on the memory card.       -   	Remind the user that they should treat the COMMCARE APPLICATION as their patient logbook/registry. If the application reinstallation fails, please collect as much information as possible and ESCALATE it to the administrator. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="restore_user-label">
						<value>RESTORE USER 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: Please enter as much information as possible about the issue. ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS: If observing the prompt to “Login in as Admin” or “Restore from Server”, Call Center agents should try to LOGIN AS ADMIN. If this is completed, ICT coordinators should follow-up RESTORE USER ID. Please refer to the Troubleshooting Manual for more specific instructions.  If unable to restore the user, please collect as much information as possible and ESCALATE the issue to the administrator. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="out_of_credit-label">
						<value>FLW OUT OF BALANCE/CREDIT 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: Please enter as much information as possible about the low balance on the phone, especially:    1.	Does the SIM have at least a minimum of Rs. 5 or is it lower than Rs. 5? Please report if the balance is low.    2.	Since when has the balance has been low?   ICT Coordinator should follow internal protocols and policies at CARE India for recharging balance.</value>
					</text>
					<text id="gprs_incorrect-label">
						<value>INCORRECT GPRS SETTINGS 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: Although the resolution for any GPRS issues will be an escalation to the ICT coordinator, a call center agent can collect as much information as possible about the symptoms of the problems before escalating.  Verify the number of unsent forms in the user’s application:    1.	Guide the user to open the application and login with their password.     2.	In the module screen, verify that the top header shows the username (10 digit mobile number).     3.	Ask if there is a number next to their mobile number? See screenshot below. In the module screen of every COMMCARE APPLICATION, you will see the username displayed in the top header, followed by a colon symbol (e.g. 9958047982:4: or demo_user:4). Ask the caller if they see a number after the colon symbol (:).     4.	Record the number. This number represents the number of unsent forms from the application. This means the user is working in CommCare and filling out forms, but the data is not being sent from the phone.     5.	Ask the caller the date since when this number has been present and increasing?    6.	Guide the user to exit the application.  Please enter as much information as possible about the GPRS setting issue experienced by the caller. Make sure to especially record the following information:       -   	What is the number of unsent forms in the application currently?       -   	Was it possible to verify GPRS configurations?       -   	Though there is sufficient balance right now, at any point did the user’s balance drop below Rs 5? How long ago?       -   	Has the user been changing or switching SIM cards, which could have led to GPRS settings being changed.  ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS: Make sure the settings on your phone have been correctly configured to enable GPRS. Often, GPRS settings will have to be configured manually. The Call Center agent should have collected the information listed above. Please refer to the Troubleshooting Manual for more detailed information on how to manually configure the GPRS settings. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="sim_not_working-label">
						<value>SIM CARD NOT WORKING 
The Call Center Agent may have collected the following information:       -   	Was it possible to verify Internet connectivity?        -   	When you tried to open the browser, did the E or G symbol appear? The ICT Coordinator should call network provider to verify why the SIM card is not connecting to the internet. Please refer to the Troubleshooting Manual for more specific instructions.  </value>
					</text>
					<text id="missing_data-label">
						<value>POSSIBILITY OF MISSING DATA 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: The Call Center Agent should try to document as much information as possible, especially:       -   	Are they seeing any cases at all?       -   	Are they seeing the same cases as their case sharing team members?       -   	Which pieces of data does the FLW believe are missing?       -   	List any specific case names and dates they were registered       -   	Is their case list partially or totally incorrect?       -   	If the FLW scrolls down the case list, do they see those “missing” cases?  ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS:    1.	Make a list of the missing cases.    2.	Navigate to CommCareHQ domain.     3.	Click on the Manage Data tab on the top header.    4.	Follow the instructions for Reassigning Cases. Refer to FAQ# 914 (verify name, husband name, and househould number of cases). </value>
					</text>
					<text id="missing_multimedia-label">
						<value>MULTIMEDIA DELETED 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: Please enter as much information as possible about the deleted multimedia, especially:       -   	Is the memory card present?       -   	Is it possible that the memory card was switched for another memory card?       -   	Have images/audio files been deleted?       -   	Has the entire multimedia folder been deleted?       -   	What are possible causes of deletion?  ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS: Please refer to the Troubleshooting Manual for specific instructions on how to reload multimedia files on the user’s phone. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="content_problem-label">
						<value>CONTENT PROBLEMS 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: Please enter as much information about the hardware or phone-related issue, especially:       -   	Record any of the doubts, queries and/or questions the FLW has with respect to the questions in the forms, skip logic, and constraints.        -   	Call Center Agent can try to answer the questions based on the Skip Logic and Constraints Guide (Appendix D) provided.   ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS: The ICT coordinator should reference the CommCare Manual (APPENDIX A) and the Form Constraints (APPENDIX D) to help answer the questions and address the doubts the user has regarding content issues. If there is an error that is reproducible, and the logic does not match the desired protocol, please ESCALATE the issue to the administrator, providing as much information as possible. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="error_in_application-label">
						<value>APPLICATION ERROR MESSAGE 
BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: **Most important is to document the application error message exactly as it appears**  When an Application Error appears:    1.	Have the caller push the middle button after the error displays. Above the middle button, the text MORE DETAILS will describe the type of error.     2.	Ask the caller to read the last line of this message and record it.    3.	If the error can be easily reproduced, document the steps you took in detail, step-by- step to cause the error to re-appear again.  PLEASE REFER TO THE MANUAL TO SEE EXAMPLES OF COMMON ERROR MESSAGES AND HOW TO RESOLVE THEM. ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS: The more information that can be provided and the sooner it can be collected, the sooner Dimagi will be able to review the problem and resolve it. If you encounter a bug or problem you cannot fix, first check to see if there is information in the manual that can help you solve the problem.  If not, please contact the in-country Dimagi representative reporting the issue. If he/she is not available, please send a bug report email to Dimagi, following the instructions listed in the Troubleshooting Manual. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="reassign_cases-label">
						<value>REASSIGN CASES 
Guide user about the perils of entering data as a Demo User. DEMO MODE is mainly used for practice and any data entered will not be recorded as actual work. LOGIN MODE is for submitting real data. They look identical when accessed.  To enter data in the LOGIN MODE,     1.	Go to the login screen of the application.     2.	Type their password (123) in the box where it says “code”.     3.	Push the down button once and you will see the “login” box turn Blue.     4.	Push the center button to enter the application in Login Mode.  If they have been entered data in demo mode, the case will need to be escalated to verify if cases are missing. BASIC INSTRUCTIONS: Try to document as much information as possible about this problem so the missing cases can be retrieved. ADVANCED INSTRUCTIONS: Please refer to the Troubleshooting Manual for more specific information on how to reassign cases. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="follow_up-label">
						<value>Follow Up</value>
					</text>
					<text id="issue_resolved-label">
						<value>Is this problem resolved?</value>
					</text>
					<text id="issue_resolved-yes-label">
						<value>Yes</value>
					</text>
					<text id="issue_resolved-no-label">
						<value>No</value>
					</text>
					<text id="issue_description-label2">
						<value>Is there anything else you would like to add?</value>
					</text>
					<text id="other_issue-label">
						<value>Please enter as much information as you can about the issue</value>
					</text>
					<text id="another_issue-label">
						<value>Does the user have any other issues?</value>
					</text>
					<text id="another_issue-yes-label">
						<value>Yes</value>
					</text>
					<text id="another_issue-no-label">
						<value>No</value>
					</text>
					<text id="has_another_problem-label">
						<value>Please fill out another form for this user.</value>
					</text>
					<text id="thanks_fixed-label">
						<value>Thanks for fixing this issue! This form is complete, please click the Submit button.</value>
					</text>
					<text id="thanks_reported-label">
						<value>Thanks for attempting to resolve this issue.  The problem has been escalated. This form is complete, please click the Submit button.</value>
					</text>
				</translation>
			</itext>
		</model>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<h:html xmlns:h="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:orx="http://openrosa.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2002/xforms" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:jr="http://openrosa.org/javarosa">
	<h:head>
		<h:title>Additional Information</h:title>
		<model>
			<instance>
				<data xmlns:jrm="http://dev.commcarehq.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://openrosa.org/formdesigner/E6FEF6DC-2E00-47D1-88DF-4CD319CB8B51" uiVersion="1" version="1" name="Additional Information">
					<change_number />
					<best_phone_number />
					<comments />
					<prev_best_phone_number />
				</data>
			</instance>
			<bind nodeset="/data/change_number" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/best_phone_number" type="xsd:string" relevant="/data/change_number = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/comments" type="xsd:string" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/prev_best_phone_number" relevant="/data/change_number = 'yes'" />
			<itext>
				<translation lang="en" default="">
					<text id="change_number-label">
						<value>Currently the best number on record to reach this FLW is <output value="/data/prev_best_phone_number"/>.  Would you like to update this?</value>
					</text>
					<text id="best_phone_number-yes-label">
						<value>Yes</value>
					</text>
					<text id="best_phone_number-no-label">
						<value>No</value>
					</text>
					<text id="b-label">
						<value>Enter the new number at which it is best to reach this FLW</value>
					</text>
					<text id="comments-label">
						<value>Please add any comments that you would like noted about this CHW</value>
					</text>
				</translation>
			</itext>
		</model>
	</h:head>
	<h:body>
		<select1 ref="/data/change_number">
			<label ref="jr:itext('change_number-label')" />
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('best_phone_number-yes-label')" />
				<value>yes</value>
			</item>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('best_phone_number-no-label')" />
				<value>no</value>
			</item>
		</select1>
		<input ref="/data/best_phone_number" appearance="numeric">
			<label ref="jr:itext('b-label')" />
		</input>
		<input ref="/data/comments">
			<label ref="jr:itext('comments-label')" />
		</input>
	</h:body>
</h:html>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<h:html xmlns:h="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:orx="http://openrosa.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2002/xforms" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:jr="http://openrosa.org/javarosa">
	<h:head>
		<h:title>Outbound Performance Feedback</h:title>
		<model>
			<instance>
				<data xmlns:jrm="http://dev.commcarehq.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://openrosa.org/formdesigner/5BBD28C0-1084-4AB1-BC0A-2F94E548AAF1" uiVersion="1" version="1" name="Outbound Performance Feedback">
					<outcome />
					<if_connected>
						<technical_problems_group>
							<technical_problems />
							<resolved_issues />
						</technical_problems_group>
						<new_technical_issue />
						<able_to_provide_feedback />
						<performance_feedback>
							<inactive_group>
								<days_inactive_label />
							</inactive_group>
							<visits_group>
								<descreased_client_visits_label />
							</visits_group>
							<form_submissions_group>
								<decreased_submissions_label />
							</form_submissions_group>
							<form_duration_label>
								<decreased_time />
								<question88 />
							</form_duration_label>
							<question89 />
						</performance_feedback>
						<go_to_tech_support>'yes'</go_to_tech_support>
					</if_connected>
					<form_complete />
					<call_back />
					<prev_issue_resolved />
					<prev_other_issue />
					<prev_outbound_performance_issue />
					<top_of_tech_support_list>'yes'</top_of_tech_support_list>
					<phone_number />
				</data>
			</instance>
			<instance id="indicators" src="jr://fixture/indicators:call-center"></instance>
			<bind nodeset="/data/outcome" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected" relevant="/data/outcome = 'connected'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/technical_problems_group" relevant="/data/prev_issue_resolved = 'no' or /data/prev_other_issue = 'yes' or /data/prev_outbound_performance_issue = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/technical_problems_group/technical_problems" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/technical_problems_group/resolved_issues" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/new_technical_issue" relevant="/data/if_connected/technical_problems_group/resolved_issues = 'yes' or /data/if_connected/technical_problems_group/resolved_issues = '' " />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/able_to_provide_feedback" relevant="/data/if_connected/new_technical_issue = 'yes' or /data/if_connected/technical_problems_group/resolved_issues = 'no'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback" relevant="/data/if_connected/able_to_provide_feedback != "no"" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/inactive_group" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/inactive_group/days_inactive_label" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/visits_group" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/visits_group/descreased_client_visits_label" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/form_submissions_group" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/form_submissions_group/decreased_submissions_label" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/form_duration_label" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/form_duration_label/decreased_time" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/form_duration_label/question88" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/question89" type="xsd:string" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/if_connected/go_to_tech_support" relevant="/data/if_connected/new_technical_issue = 'yes'" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/form_complete" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/call_back" calculate="if(/data/outcome = "call_back", 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/prev_issue_resolved" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/prev_other_issue" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/prev_outbound_performance_issue" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/top_of_tech_support_list" calculate="if(/data/if_connected/go_to_tech_support = 'yes', 'yes', 'no')" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/phone_number" />
			<itext>
				<translation lang="en" default="">
					<text id="outcome-label">
						<value>What is the outcome of the call?</value>
					</text>
					<text id="outcome-connected-label">
						<value>Connected</value>
					</text>
					<text id="outcome-not_available-label">
						<value>Not available</value>
					</text>
					<text id="outcome-call_back-label">
						<value>Call back later today</value>
					</text>
					<text id="technical_problems_group-label">
						<value>Previous technical problems</value>
					</text>
					<text id="technical_problems-label">
						<value>FLW was previously experiencing issues with phone</value>
					</text>
					<text id="resolved_issues-label">
						<value>Have these issue since been resolved</value>
					</text>
					<text id="resolved_issues-yes-label">
						<value>Yes</value>
					</text>
					<text id="resolved_issues-no-label">
						<value>No</value>
					</text>
					<text id="new_technical_issue-label">
						<value>Are you currently facing any technical problems with your phone?</value>

					<text id="new_technical_issue-yes-label">

					</text>
					<text id="new_technical_issue-no-label">
						<value>No</value>
					</text>
					<text id="able_to_provide_feedback-label">
						<value>Despite these technical issues are you still able to provide performance feedback?</value>
					</text>
					<text id="able_to_provide_feedback-yes-label">
						<value>Yes</value>
					</text>
					<text id="able_to_provide_feedback-no-label">
						<value>No</value>
					</text>
					<text id="performance_feedback-label">

					</text>
					<text id="inactive_group-label">

					</text>

					</text>
					<text id="descreased_client_visits_label-label">
						<value>In the last month, you have visited x% of your clients.  This is a -decrease/increae- from last month, when you visited y% of your clients.</value>
					</text>
					<text id="form_submissions_group-label">
						<value>Form submissions</value>
					</text>
					<text id="decreased_submissions_label-label">
						<value>In the last week, you have submitted X number of forms.  This is a -decrease/increase- from last week, when you submitted Y number of forms.</value>
					</text>
					<text id="form_duration_label-label">
						<value>Form duration</value>
					</text>
					<text id="decreased_time-label">
						<value>In the last week, the average time it took you to fill out the X counseling form was Y minutes</value>
					</text>
					<text id="question88-label">
						<value>Remember, visit times should be Z number of minutes. Be sure to explain each concept clearly and descriptively and discuss it with the beneficiary. </value>
					</text>
					<text id="question89-label">
						<value>Is everything OK? Are you facing any problems at work or at home that are affecting your performance?</value>
					</text>
					<text id="go_to_tech_support-label">
						<value>This form is complete, but FLW is still experiencing technical issues.  After submitting this form, open the tech support form and help this FLW troubleshoot phone issues.</value>
					</text>
					<text id="form_complete-label">
						<value>This form is complete. </value>
					</text>
				</translation>
			</itext>
		</model>
	</h:head>
	<h:body>
		<select1 ref="/data/outcome">

			<select1 ref="/data/if_connected/new_technical_issue">

				<item>
					<label ref="jr:itext('new_technical_issue-no-label')" />

			<select1 ref="/data/if_connected/able_to_provide_feedback">
				<label ref="jr:itext('able_to_provide_feedback-label')" />
				<item>
					<label ref="jr:itext('able_to_provide_feedback-yes-label')" />

				<item>
					<label ref="jr:itext('able_to_provide_feedback-no-label')" />

			<group ref="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback">
				<label ref="jr:itext('performance_feedback-label')" />
				<group ref="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/inactive_group">
					<label ref="jr:itext('inactive_group-label')" />
					<trigger ref="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/inactive_group/days_inactive_label">
						<label ref="jr:itext('days_inactive_label-label')" />
					</trigger>
				</group>
				<group ref="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/visits_group">

						<label ref="jr:itext('descreased_client_visits_label-label')" />
					</trigger>
				</group>
				<group ref="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/form_submissions_group">
					<label ref="jr:itext('form_submissions_group-label')" />
					<trigger ref="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/form_submissions_group/decreased_submissions_label">
						<label ref="jr:itext('decreased_submissions_label-label')" />
					</trigger>
				</group>
				<group ref="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/form_duration_label">
					<label ref="jr:itext('form_duration_label-label')" />
					<trigger ref="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/form_duration_label/decreased_time">
						<label ref="jr:itext('decreased_time-label')" />
					</trigger>
					<trigger ref="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/form_duration_label/question88">
						<label ref="jr:itext('question88-label')" />

				<input ref="/data/if_connected/performance_feedback/question89">

			<trigger ref="/data/if_connected/go_to_tech_support">

		<trigger ref="/data/form_complete">
